One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a farmer in a field. The farmer was sad because he had no wheat. Tim had a bag of lucky wheat seeds. He wanted to help the farmer.
Tim said, "I have lucky wheat seeds. I will set them in your field. They will grow big and strong." The farmer was happy and thanked Tim. Together, they set the lucky wheat seeds in the field.

The children quickly turned to each other and smiled. “Let’s go!” they said in unison.
As they climbed the mountain, the sun began to set. The children felt a bit scared as the light grew dull, but they continued climbing. Finally, they reached the top and the picnic was ready. 
The children’s parents were so surprised and pleased. They hugged the children and said, “Thank you for designing such a special picnic. You two have made this moment so special.” 
The children beamed with pride, happy to have made their parents so happy.

It was a voice of an old man who had sunk in the soil. Jack tried to help the old man by pulling him out, but he was too weak.
Jack then called his friends to help him. With their combined strength, they managed to get the old man out.
The old man thanked the boys, but he had nothing to pay them. Jack, however, remained humble and insisted that they didn't need to be paid. The old man then said "Not being paid will make you ignorant, kind boy". To which Jack responded "Ignorance is not bliss; but compassion is worth more than gold".
